availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James L. Caldwell (Judge Shelby Co Court)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Attended Bethel College in Russellville, Kentucky. Attended Bethany College in Bethany, Virginia. Married Mary L. Middleton Caldwell. Father of Sarah Caldwell, Eugene Caldwell, Bettie V. Caldwell, Mary A. Caldwell, and Clarence Caldwell. Attorney in Shelby County in 1850. Owned five enslaved people in Shelby County in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Shelby County from 1851 to 1852 and from 1855 to 1856. Presiding Judge of the Shelby County Court from 1859 to 1871. Attorney and farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved people in Shelby County in 1860. Member of the Christian Church of Shelbyville in Shelbyville.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 2, p. 369 B; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 2, p. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 2, p. 2; W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 6th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1888), 770; Find A Grave, "Judge James Lafayette Caldwell (1825 - 1882)," Memorial #104690651, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=104690651 (accessed September 28, 2017).
